content: @Chris Hughes @Rob Lewis
@Kenny Lau You are being cryptic again.

Kenny, this kind of comment is rude and unhelpful. Think about how you could rephrase this constructively. In this case, maybe: "FYI, there's a typo in the commit message." To me, that comment points out something irrelevant, and I wouldn't send it. Perhaps you think it's relevant, and that's fine. But writing "How about we be more careful?" doesn't make it clear what you mean and it's completely unnecessarily aggressive.

@Kenny Lau There's an easy fix:
(i) you create 10 PRs
(ii) the PRs get merged
(iii) the commit message with typo is now below the fold.
